title: High Renewable Energy Consumption
description: In 2021, 96.3% of DR Congo's total final energy consumption came from renewable sources, showcasing a strong commitment to sustainable energy.

title: Heavy Reliance on Combustible Renewables and Waste
description: As of 2022, 92.9% of DR Congo's energy comes from combustible renewables and waste, indicating a dependence on traditional biomass.

title: Rapid Growth in Imports
description: In 2023, DR Congo experienced an 85.6% annual growth in imports of goods and services, reflecting increased economic activity and demand.

title: Significant Mineral Depletion
description: Mineral depletion accounted for 22.7% of DR Congo's GNI in 2021, highlighting the economic reliance on mining activities.

title: High Mineral Rents Contribution to GDP
description: In 2021, mineral rents constituted 28.8% of DR Congo's GDP, underscoring the importance of the mining sector to the economy.

title: High Out-of-School Rate for Primary Children
description: In 2019, 63.2% of primary school-age children were out of school, indicating significant challenges in the education sector.

title: Severe Poverty Levels
description: In 2020, 85.3% of the population lived below the $3.00 a day poverty line, reflecting widespread poverty.

title: High Multidimensional Poverty
description: 88% of the population experienced multidimensional poverty in 2020, indicating deprivation in multiple areas of well-being.

title: Complete Binding Coverage for Trade Products
description: In 2020, DR Congo achieved 100% binding coverage for all products, ensuring tariff predictability in international trade.

title: Dominance of Ores and Metals in Exports
description: Ores and metals made up 76.3% of merchandise exports in 2023, highlighting the country's export dependency on these commodities.

title: Minimal Urban Land Vulnerability to Sea Level Rise
description: In 2015, only 0.00012% of DR Congo's urban land area was below 5 meters in elevation, indicating minimal vulnerability to sea level rise.

title: Negligible Natural Gas Dependency for Electricity
description: As of 2018, only 0.009% of DR Congo's electricity was produced from natural gas, showcasing a low dependency on this fossil fuel source.

title: Low Carbon Emissions from Buildings
description: In 2023, DR Congo's carbon dioxide emissions from buildings were a mere 0.0002 Mt CO2e, reflecting minimal environmental impact from this sector.

title: Limited Fossil Fuel Energy Consumption
description: By 2022, fossil fuels accounted for only 3.97% of DR Congo's total energy consumption, indicating a low reliance on non-renewable energy sources.

title: Minimal Natural Gas Revenue Contribution
description: In 2019, natural gas rents contributed a negligible 0.00006% to DR Congo's GDP, highlighting a minimal economic dependency on this resource.

title: Low Educational Attainment at Doctoral Level
description: As of 2016, only 0.03% of DR Congo's male population aged 25+ had attained a doctoral degree, indicating a significant gap in higher education.

title: Limited Access to Basic Drinking Water Services
description: In 2022, only 35.12% of DR Congo's population had access to basic drinking water services, highlighting a critical area for infrastructure improvement.

title: Scarcity of Researchers in R&D
description: In 2015, DR Congo had only 10 researchers per million people, indicating a significant gap in research and development capacity.

title: Minimal Contribution of Travel Services to Exports
description: By 2023, travel services accounted for only 2.43% of DR Congo's service exports, suggesting limited development in the tourism sector.
